title: China Is Breeding Pigs As Big As Polar Bears As There Is A Shortage Of Pork In The Country!
text:
China Is Breeding Pigs As Big As Polar Bears As There Is A Shortage Of Pork In The Country!

China Is Breeding Pigs As Big As Polar Bears As There Is A Shortage Of Pork In The Country!

Apparently, there is a shortage of pork (pig meat) in the Chinese market. So, the Chinese farmers have now decided to breed pigs as big as polar bears, to deal with that shortage.

There is a countrywide shortage of pork is because of a devastating outbreak of African swine fever.

A Chinese farmer has already reportedly bred a pig as big as a polar bear and these can weigh more than 1,100 pounds (approx 500 kg), and can fetch the owner at least $1400 (approx Rs 1 lakh) in the market, which is three times the average monthly income of a farmer.

Reuters

As you would have probably guessed, China is the world’s largest pork consumer and its prices shot up in recent months, owing to its shortage.

Wens Foodstuffs Group Co is the country’s top pig breeder and even they are trying to increase the size of their pigs.

Clearly the Chinese people love pork too much, hence the Chinese government has announced a nationwide initiative to boost pork production to bring the hiked prices under control.

Peng Shaozong of the National Development and Reform Commission reportedly said, “We are confident and capable of rising to the challenge, dissolving the risks and doing well in keeping prices in the pig market stable.”

Well, they are obviously not oinking around.
